content:
That's awesome! Taking a hip hop class is a great way to get into the genre. Here are some hip hop music recommendations to get you started:

**Classic Hip Hop**

1. Old School:
	* Run-DMC - "Walk This Way" (feat. Aerosmith)
	* Beastie Boys - "Fight for Your Right"
	* LL Cool J - "Mama Said Knock You Out"
2. Golden Age:
	* Nas - "N.Y. State of Mind" (feat. Jay-Z)
	* The Notorious B.I.G. - "Juicy"
	* Tupac Shakur - "California Love" (feat. Dr. Dre)

**Modern Hip Hop**

1. Mainstream:
	* Kendrick Lamar - "Humble."
	* Cardi B - "Bodak Yellow"
	* Travis Scott - "Sicko Mode"
2. Underground:
	* J. Cole - "Middle Child"
	* Logic - "1-800-273-8255" (feat. Alessia Cara, KAYTRANADA)
	* Joey Bada$$ - "Devastated"

**Hip Hop Sub-Genres**

1. Trap:
	* Migos - "Bad and Boujee" (feat. Lil Uzi Vert)
	* Lil Baby - "Yes Indeed" (feat. Drake)
	* Gunna - "Sold Out Dates" (feat. Lil Baby)
2. West Coast:
	* N.W.A - "Straight Outta Compton"
	* Game - "Hate It or Love It" (feat. 50 Cent)
	* G-Eazy - "Me, Myself & I" (feat. Bebe Rexha)

**Hip Hop Influenced Pop**

1. Pop-Rap:
	* Post Malone - "Psycho" (feat. Ty Dolla Sign)
	* Nicki Minaj - "Chun-Li"
	* Iggy Azalea - "Fancy" (feat. Charli XCX)
2. R&B-Hip Hop Fusion:
	* The Weeknd - "The Hills"
	* Drake - "One Dance" (feat. WizKid, Kyla)
	* Bryson Tiller - "Don't"

These are just a few examples to get you started. You can explore these artists and songs to find more music that resonates with you. You might also want to check out playlists on music streaming platforms like Spotify, Apple Music, or Tidal, which often feature hip hop playlists curated by DJs, artists, or music experts.

Remember, hip hop is a diverse genre, and there's always something new to discover. Have fun exploring, and enjoy your hip hop class!
